Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DSeBT |
| donor (D)-acceptor (A) polymers |
| lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) |
| highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: On the basis of our results , one can be concluded that the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor ( A ) polymers is an easy and effective way to realize both the higher J SC and V OC values in PSCs , as a consequence of the selective lower - lying lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) with the HOMO being almost unchanged , together with the effective broadening on the absorption band .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| higher J SC values |
| V OC values |
| selective lower - lying LUMO |
| HOMO |
| the absorption band |

The "Property Name" entities identified in the paragraph are "higher J SC values", "V OC values", "selective lower - lying LUMO", "HOMO", and "the absorption band". These entities are mentioned as a result of the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor (A) polymers in PSCs.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the entities identified in the previous answer, I realize that not all of them are clear "Material Property" entities. Here are the revised "Property Name" entities that are mentioned as a result of the DSeBT placement for construction of donor (D)-acceptor (A) polymers in PSCs:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| higher J SC values |
| V OC values |
| selective lower - lying LUMO |
| HOMO |

The entities "higher J SC values" and "V OC values" refer to the short-circuit current density and open-circuit voltage, respectively, which are important material properties in photovoltaic devices. The entities "selective lower - lying LUMO" and "HOMO" refer to the energy levels of the frontier orbitals in materials, which are also important material properties.
